stance_1: I am aware eating a lot of meat isn't healthiest
stance_2: I eat meat regularly
justification: The interviewee is aware that eating a lot of meat isn't the healthiest, which is in tension with their regular meat consumption.

stance_1: I am aware eating a lot of meat isn't healthiest
stance_2: I want a more balanced diet
justification: Awareness that eating a lot of meat isn't healthiest supports the desire for a more balanced diet.

stance_1: I am aware eating a lot of meat isn't healthiest
stance_2: I want to feel healthier
justification: Awareness of the healthiness of meat supports wanting to feel healthier.

stance_1: I am aware eating a lot of meat isn't healthiest
stance_2: I am open to small changes
justification: Awareness that eating a lot of meat isn't the healthiest supports openness to making small changes.

stance_2: Meat is part of my routine
justification: Eating meat regularly and meat being part of the routine are directly supportive of each other.

stance_2: I find meat convenient
justification: Finding meat convenient supports eating it regularly.

stance_2: I grew up eating meat
justification: Growing up eating meat supports the habit of eating meat regularly.

stance_2: Most recipes I know use meat
justification: Knowing mostly meat-based recipes supports regular meat consumption.

stance_2: Meat keeps me full longer
justification: Meat keeping them full longer supports eating it regularly.

stance_2: My family and friends eat meat regularly
justification: Eating meat is reinforced by family and social environment.

stance_2: Meals with others usually include meat
justification: Meals with others including meat supports regular consumption.

stance_2: Tradition encourages meat eating
justification: Tradition supports regular meat consumption.

stance_2: I am open to small changes
justification: Being open to small changes is somewhat in tension with eating meat regularly.
